headline.main: YUGOSLAVIA IS SEEN BY TURKS AS ALLY; Cooperation Against Any Axis Aggression in the Balkans Regarded as Certain HITLER HELD UNPREPARED Germans Face Possibility of Having Initiative in Balkans Wrested From Them

lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL, March 30 (Delayed) -- Interest aroused by the news that the Yugoslav Ambassador to Turkey, Ilia Choumenkovitch, will go shortly to Belgrade taken in conjunction with various articles in the Turkish press and the views expressed to the writer by Turkish leaders, indicate how strong are the hopes held here that it may be possible to arrange effective Turkish-Yugoslav cooperation for the defense of the interests of both countries.
abstract: Istanbul sources see Yugoslav cooperation with Brit, Greeks and Turks to resist Axis; Yugoslav Amb to Turkey, I Choumenkovitch, to visit Belgrade

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
